channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump tries to claim that a picture of thousands of Harris supporters was faked
item.description: In Detroit last week, Harris and Walz were greeted by thousands of supporters. But former President Donald Trump and his supporters have tried to claim that a photo of the real crowd was fake.
item.content:encoded: In Detroit last week, Harris and Walz were greeted by thousands of supporters. But former President Donald Trump and his supporters have tried to claim that a photo of the real crowd was fake.
item.dc:creator: Jude Joffe-Block

item.title: A woman's death after stillbirth is a reminder of the U.S.'s maternal mortality issue
item.description: Krystal Anderson died of sepsis a few days after giving birth to a stillborn baby. It was her second bout of maternal sepsis. Even though she was in the care of specialists, she died.
item.content:encoded: Krystal Anderson died of sepsis a few days after giving birth to a stillborn baby. It was her second bout of maternal sepsis. Even though she was in the care of specialists, she died.
item.dc:creator: Bek Shackelford

item.title: A history of Hezbollah
item.description: Hezbollah has been exchanging missile fire with Israel. Here's how the most powerful military and political force in Lebanon came to be.
item.content:encoded: Hezbollah has been exchanging missile fire with Israel. Here's how the most powerful military and political force in Lebanon came to be.
item.dc:creator: Rund Abdelfatah

item.title: Puerto Rico braces for Tropical Storm Ernesto
item.description: Tropical Storm Ernesto is expected to pass over Puerto Rico late Tuesday night, which could bring flooding, landslides and power outages. The island has closed schools and opened shelters.
item.content:encoded: Tropical Storm Ernesto is expected to pass over Puerto Rico late Tuesday night, which could bring flooding, landslides and power outages. The island has closed schools and opened shelters.
item.dc:creator: Adrian Florido

item.title: People in states with abortion bans are getting pills through telehealth
item.description: As the number of abortions nationwide continues to grow, pregnant people in states with restrictions and bans are accessing pills from out-of-state providers. Some say they're breaking the law.
item.content:encoded: As the number of abortions nationwide continues to grow, pregnant people in states with restrictions and bans are accessing pills from out-of-state providers. Some say they're breaking the law.
item.dc:creator: Elissa Nadworny

item.title: Trump and Harris support no tax on tips, but experts say it could complicate things
item.description: Both presidential nominees support no tax on tips. But this now-popular campaign issue is making tax experts and economists shake their heads.
item.content:encoded: Both presidential nominees support no tax on tips. But this now-popular campaign issue is making tax experts and economists shake their heads.
item.dc:creator: Luke Garrett

item.title: The ant that's taken over Manhattan
item.description: A decade ago, a new ant showed up in NYC. Now, it's everywhere in the city and is spreading at a rate of about a mile a year. Scientists are trying to understand why this ant has been so successful.
item.content:encoded: A decade ago, a new ant showed up in NYC. Now, it's everywhere in the city and is spreading at a rate of about a mile a year. Scientists are trying to understand why this ant has been so successful.
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: Hospitals struggle after hackers target a blood donation center
item.description: Hospitals across the southeastern United States are struggling in the wake of a cyberattack on a regional blood donation service.
item.content:encoded: Hospitals across the southeastern United States are struggling in the wake of a cyberattack on a regional blood donation service.
item.dc:creator: Jenna McLaughlin

item.title: How Tim Walz handled the George Floyd protests as the governor of Minnesota
item.description: Minnesota Public Radio's Brandt Williams talks about Gov. Tim Walz and the George Floyd protests. Walz is now the presumed Democratic vice presidential candidate.
item.content:encoded: Minnesota Public Radio's Brandt Williams talks about Gov. Tim Walz and the George Floyd protests. Walz is now the presumed Democratic vice presidential candidate.
item.dc:creator: Brandt Williams

item.title: A Tel Aviv cafe is a shrine to a man who died in Oct. 7 Hamas attack
item.description: Cafe Otef in Tel Aviv is a shrine to the owner's ex-husband, who was killed on the Oct. 7 Hamas-led attack on Israel.
item.content:encoded: Cafe Otef in Tel Aviv is a shrine to the owner's ex-husband, who was killed on the Oct. 7 Hamas-led attack on Israel.
item.dc:creator: Itay Stern
